name: mirror
title: Google Mirror API
description: Interacts with Glass users via the timeline.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

schemas.name: MenuItem
schemas.desc: A custom menu item that can be presented to the user by a timeline item.

fields.name: removeWhenSelected
fields.desc: If set to true on a CUSTOM menu item, that item will be removed from the menu after it is selected.

fields.name: values
fields.desc: For CUSTOM items, a list of values controlling the appearance of the menu item in each of its states. A value for the DEFAULT state must be provided. If the PENDING or CONFIRMED states are missing, they will not be shown.

fields.name: action
fields.desc:
Controls the behavior when the user picks the menu option. Allowed values are:  
- CUSTOM - Custom action set by the service. When the user selects this menuItem, the API triggers a notification to your callbackUrl with the userActions.type set to CUSTOM and the userActions.payload set to the ID of this menu item. This is the default value. 
- Built-in actions:  
- REPLY - Initiate a reply to the timeline item using the voice recording UI. The creator attribute must be set in the timeline item for this menu to be available. 
- REPLY_ALL - Same behavior as REPLY. The original timeline item's recipients will be added to the reply item. 
- DELETE - Delete the timeline item. 
- SHARE - Share the timeline item with the available contacts. 
- READ_ALOUD - Read the timeline item's speakableText aloud; if this field is not set, read the text field; if none of those fields are set, this menu item is ignored. 
- GET_MEDIA_INPUT - Allow users to provide media payloads to Glassware from a menu item (currently, only transcribed text from voice input is supported). Subscribe to notifications when users invoke this menu item to receive the timeline item ID. Retrieve the media from the timeline item in the payload property. 
- VOICE_CALL - Initiate a phone call using the timeline item's creator.phoneNumber attribute as recipient. 
- NAVIGATE - Navigate to the timeline item's location. 
- TOGGLE_PINNED - Toggle the isPinned state of the timeline item. 
- OPEN_URI - Open the payload of the menu item in the browser. 
- PLAY_VIDEO - Open the payload of the menu item in the Glass video player. 
- SEND_MESSAGE - Initiate sending a message to the timeline item's creator:  
- If the creator.phoneNumber is set and Glass is connected to an Android phone, the message is an SMS. 
- Otherwise, if the creator.email is set, the message is an email.

fields.name: contextual_command
fields.desc: The ContextualMenus.Command associated with this MenuItem (e.g. READ_ALOUD). The voice label for this command will be displayed in the voice menu and the touch label will be displayed in the touch menu. Note that the default menu value's display name will be overriden if you specify this property. Values that do not correspond to a ContextualMenus.Command name will be ignored.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The ID for this menu item. This is generated by the application and is treated as an opaque token.

fields.name: payload
fields.desc:
A generic payload whose meaning changes depending on this MenuItem's action.  
- When the action is OPEN_URI, the payload is the URL of the website to view. 
- When the action is PLAY_VIDEO, the payload is the streaming URL of the video 
- When the action is GET_MEDIA_INPUT, the payload is the text transcription of a user's speech input

fields.name: id
fields.desc:
The setting's ID. The following IDs are valid:  
- locale - The key to the user’s language/locale (BCP 47 identifier) that Glassware should use to render localized content.  
- timezone - The key to the user’s current time zone region as defined in the tz database. Example: America/Los_Angeles.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: The type of resource. This is always mirror#setting.

fields.name: value
fields.desc: The setting value, as a string.

schemas.name: TimelineListResponse
schemas.desc: A list of timeline items. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the timeline collection.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: Items in the timeline.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: The type of resource. This is always mirror#timeline.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: The next page token. Provide this as the pageToken parameter in the request to retrieve the next page of results.

schemas.name: AttachmentsListResponse
schemas.desc: A list of Attachments. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the attachments collection.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: The type of resource. This is always mirror#attachmentsList.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: The list of attachments.

schemas.name: ContactsListResponse
schemas.desc: A list of Contacts representing contacts. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the contacts collection.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: Contact list.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: The type of resource. This is always mirror#contacts.

schemas.name: LocationsListResponse
schemas.desc: A list of Locations. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the locations collection.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: The list of locations.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: The type of resource. This is always mirror#locationsList.

schemas.name: NotificationConfig
schemas.desc: Controls how notifications for a timeline item are presented to the user.

fields.name: deliveryTime
fields.desc: The time at which the notification should be delivered.

fields.name: level
fields.desc:
Describes how important the notification is. Allowed values are:  
- DEFAULT - Notifications of default importance. A chime will be played to alert users.

schemas.name: Account
schemas.desc: Represents an account passed into the Account Manager on Glass.

schemas.name: Contact
schemas.desc: A person or group that can be used as a creator or a contact.

fields.name: imageUrls
fields.desc: Set of image URLs to display for a contact. Most contacts will have a single image, but a "group" contact may include up to 8 image URLs and they will be resized and cropped into a mosaic on the client.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: The type of resource. This is always mirror#contact.

fields.name: speakableName
fields.desc: Name of this contact as it should be pronounced. If this contact's name must be spoken as part of a voice disambiguation menu, this name is used as the expected pronunciation. This is useful for contact names with unpronounceable characters or whose display spelling is otherwise not phonetic.

fields.name: source
fields.desc: The ID of the application that created this contact. This is populated by the API

fields.name: acceptCommands
fields.desc: A list of voice menu commands that a contact can handle. Glass shows up to three contacts for each voice menu command. If there are more than that, the three contacts with the highest priority are shown for that particular command.

fields.name: acceptTypes
fields.desc: A list of MIME types that a contact supports. The contact will be shown to the user if any of its acceptTypes matches any of the types of the attachments on the item. If no acceptTypes are given, the contact will be shown for all items.

fields.name: displayName
fields.desc: The name to display for this contact.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: An ID for this contact. This is generated by the application and is treated as an opaque token.

fields.name: phoneNumber
fields.desc: Primary phone number for the contact. This can be a fully-qualified number, with country calling code and area code, or a local number.

fields.name: priority
fields.desc: Priority for the contact to determine ordering in a list of contacts. Contacts with higher priorities will be shown before ones with lower priorities.

fields.name: sharingFeatures
fields.desc:
A list of sharing features that a contact can handle. Allowed values are:  
- ADD_CAPTION

fields.name: type
fields.desc:
The type for this contact. This is used for sorting in UIs. Allowed values are:  
- INDIVIDUAL - Represents a single person. This is the default. 
- GROUP - Represents more than a single person.

schemas.name: Location
schemas.desc: A geographic location that can be associated with a timeline item.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The ID of the location.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: The type of resource. This is always mirror#location.

fields.name: latitude
fields.desc: The latitude, in degrees.

fields.name: longitude
fields.desc: The longitude, in degrees.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.desc: The time at which this location was captured, formatted according to RFC 3339.

fields.name: accuracy
fields.desc: The accuracy of the location fix in meters.

fields.name: address
fields.desc: The full address of the location.

fields.name: displayName
fields.desc: The name to be displayed. This may be a business name or a user-defined place, such as "Home".

schemas.name: MenuValue
schemas.desc: A single value that is part of a MenuItem.

fields.name: displayName
fields.desc: The name to display for the menu item. If you specify this property for a built-in menu item, the default contextual voice command for that menu item is not shown.

fields.name: iconUrl
fields.desc: URL of an icon to display with the menu item.

fields.name: state
fields.desc:
The state that this value applies to. Allowed values are:  
- DEFAULT - Default value shown when displayed in the menuItems list. 
- PENDING - Value shown when the menuItem has been selected by the user but can still be cancelled. 
- CONFIRMED - Value shown when the menuItem has been selected by the user and can no longer be cancelled.

schemas.name: Notification
schemas.desc: A notification delivered by the API.

fields.name: userToken
fields.desc: The user token provided by the service when it subscribed for notifications.

fields.name: verifyToken
fields.desc: The secret verify token provided by the service when it subscribed for notifications.

fields.name: collection
fields.desc: The collection that generated the notification.

fields.name: itemId
fields.desc: The ID of the item that generated the notification.

fields.name: operation
fields.desc: The type of operation that generated the notification.

fields.name: userActions
fields.desc: A list of actions taken by the user that triggered the notification.

schemas.name: SubscriptionsListResponse
schemas.desc: A list of Subscriptions. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the subscription collection.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: The list of subscriptions.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: The type of resource. This is always mirror#subscriptionsList.

schemas.name: TimelineItem
schemas.desc: Each item in the user's timeline is represented as a TimelineItem JSON structure, described below.

fields.name: attachments
fields.desc: A list of media attachments associated with this item. As a convenience, you can refer to attachments in your HTML payloads with the attachment or cid scheme. For example: - attachment: where attachment_index is the 0-based index of this array. - cid: where attachment_id is the ID of the attachment.

fields.name: canonicalUrl
fields.desc: A canonical URL pointing to the canonical/high quality version of the data represented by the timeline item.

fields.name: etag
fields.desc: ETag for this item.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: The type of resource. This is always mirror#timelineItem.

fields.name: recipients
fields.desc: A list of users or groups that this item has been shared with.

fields.name: bundleId
fields.desc: The bundle ID for this item. Services can specify a bundleId to group many items together. They appear under a single top-level item on the device.

fields.name: creator
fields.desc: The user or group that created this item.

fields.name: displayTime
fields.desc: The time that should be displayed when this item is viewed in the timeline, formatted according to RFC 3339. This user's timeline is sorted chronologically on display time, so this will also determine where the item is displayed in the timeline. If not set by the service, the display time defaults to the updated time.

fields.name: location
fields.desc: The geographic location associated with this item.

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: A URL that can be used to retrieve this item.

fields.name: sourceItemId
fields.desc: Opaque string you can use to map a timeline item to data in your own service.

fields.name: text
fields.desc: Text content of this item.

fields.name: created
fields.desc: The time at which this item was created, formatted according to RFC 3339.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The ID of the timeline item. This is unique within a user's timeline.

fields.name: inReplyTo
fields.desc: If this item was generated as a reply to another item, this field will be set to the ID of the item being replied to. This can be used to attach a reply to the appropriate conversation or post.

fields.name: isDeleted
fields.desc: When true, indicates this item is deleted, and only the ID property is set.

fields.name: isPinned
fields.desc: When true, indicates this item is pinned, which means it's grouped alongside "active" items like navigation and hangouts, on the opposite side of the home screen from historical (non-pinned) timeline items. You can allow the user to toggle the value of this property with the TOGGLE_PINNED built-in menu item.

fields.name: notification
fields.desc: Controls how notifications for this item are presented on the device. If this is missing, no notification will be generated.

fields.name: html
fields.desc:
HTML content for this item. If both text and html are provided for an item, the html will be rendered in the timeline.
Allowed HTML elements - You can use these elements in your timeline cards.
 
- Headers: h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6 
- Images: img 
- Lists: li, ol, ul 
- HTML5 semantics: article, aside, details, figure, figcaption, footer, header, nav, section, summary, time 
- Structural: blockquote, br, div, hr, p, span 
- Style: b, big, center, em, i, u, s, small, strike, strong, style, sub, sup 
- Tables: table, tbody, td, tfoot, th, thead, tr  
Blocked HTML elements: These elements and their contents are removed from HTML payloads.
 
- Document headers: head, title 
- Embeds: audio, embed, object, source, video 
- Frames: frame, frameset 
- Scripting: applet, script  
Other elements: Any elements that aren't listed are removed, but their contents are preserved.

fields.name: isBundleCover
fields.desc:
Whether this item is a bundle cover.

If an item is marked as a bundle cover, it will be the entry point to the bundle of items that have the same bundleId as that item. It will be shown only on the main timeline — not within the opened bundle.

On the main timeline, items that are shown are:  
- Items that have isBundleCover set to true  
- Items that do not have a bundleId  In a bundle sub-timeline, items that are shown are:  
- Items that have the bundleId in question AND isBundleCover set to false

fields.name: menuItems
fields.desc: A list of menu items that will be presented to the user when this item is selected in the timeline.

fields.name: pinScore
fields.desc: For pinned items, this determines the order in which the item is displayed in the timeline, with a higher score appearing closer to the clock. Note: setting this field is currently not supported.

fields.name: speakableText
fields.desc:
The speakable version of the content of this item. Along with the READ_ALOUD menu item, use this field to provide text that would be clearer when read aloud, or to provide extended information to what is displayed visually on Glass.

Glassware should also specify the speakableType field, which will be spoken before this text in cases where the additional context is useful, for example when the user requests that the item be read aloud following a notification.

fields.name: speakableType
fields.desc:
A speakable description of the type of this item. This will be announced to the user prior to reading the content of the item in cases where the additional context is useful, for example when the user requests that the item be read aloud following a notification.

This should be a short, simple noun phrase such as "Email", "Text message", or "Daily Planet News Update".

Glassware are encouraged to populate this field for every timeline item, even if the item does not contain speakableText or text so that the user can learn the type of the item without looking at the screen.

fields.name: title
fields.desc: The title of this item.

fields.name: updated
fields.desc: The time at which this item was last modified, formatted according to RFC 3339.

schemas.name: Attachment
schemas.desc: Represents media content, such as a photo, that can be attached to a timeline item.

fields.name: contentType
fields.desc: The MIME type of the attachment.

fields.name: contentUrl
fields.desc: The URL for the content.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The ID of the attachment.

fields.name: isProcessingContent
fields.desc: Indicates that the contentUrl is not available because the attachment content is still being processed. If the caller wishes to retrieve the content, it should try again later.

schemas.name: Subscription
schemas.desc: A subscription to events on a collection.

fields.name: notification
fields.desc: Container object for notifications. This is not populated in the Subscription resource.

fields.name: operation
fields.desc:
A list of operations that should be subscribed to. An empty list indicates that all operations on the collection should be subscribed to. Allowed values are:  
- UPDATE - The item has been updated. 
- INSERT - A new item has been inserted. 
- DELETE - The item has been deleted. 
- MENU_ACTION - A custom menu item has been triggered by the user.

fields.name: updated
fields.desc: The time at which this subscription was last modified, formatted according to RFC 3339.

fields.name: userToken
fields.desc: An opaque token sent to the subscriber in notifications so that it can determine the ID of the user.

fields.name: verifyToken
fields.desc: A secret token sent to the subscriber in notifications so that it can verify that the notification was generated by Google.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The ID of the subscription.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: The type of resource. This is always mirror#subscription.

fields.name: callbackUrl
fields.desc: The URL where notifications should be delivered (must start with https://).

fields.name: collection
fields.desc:
The collection to subscribe to. Allowed values are:  
- timeline - Changes in the timeline including insertion, deletion, and updates. 
- locations - Location updates. 
- settings - Settings updates.

schemas.name: UserAction
schemas.desc: Represents an action taken by the user that triggered a notification.

fields.name: payload
fields.desc:
An optional payload for the action.

For actions of type CUSTOM, this is the ID of the custom menu item that was selected.

fields.name: type
fields.desc:
The type of action. The value of this can be:  
- SHARE - the user shared an item. 
- REPLY - the user replied to an item. 
- REPLY_ALL - the user replied to all recipients of an item. 
- CUSTOM - the user selected a custom menu item on the timeline item. 
- DELETE - the user deleted the item. 
- PIN - the user pinned the item. 
- UNPIN - the user unpinned the item. 
- LAUNCH - the user initiated a voice command.  In the future, additional types may be added. UserActions with unrecognized types should be ignored.

schemas.name: Command
schemas.desc: A single menu command that is part of a Contact.

fields.name: type
fields.desc:
The type of operation this command corresponds to. Allowed values are:  
- TAKE_A_NOTE - Shares a timeline item with the transcription of user speech from the "Take a note" voice menu command.  
- POST_AN_UPDATE - Shares a timeline item with the transcription of user speech from the "Post an update" voice menu command.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets a single setting by ID.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc:
The ID of the setting. The following IDs are valid: 
- locale - The key to the user’s language/locale (BCP 47 identifier) that Glassware should use to render localized content. 
- timezone - The key to the user’s current time zone region as defined in the tz database. Example: America/Los_Angeles.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Deletes a subscription.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the subscription.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Creates a new subscription.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Retrieves a list of subscriptions for the authenticated user and service.

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Updates an existing subscription in place.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the subscription.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Deletes a timeline item.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the timeline item.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets a single timeline item by ID.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the timeline item.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Inserts a new item into the timeline.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Retrieves a list of timeline items for the authenticated user.

optinalQueryParams.name: sourceItemId
optinalQueryParams.desc: If provided, only items with the given sourceItemId will be returned.

optinalQueryParams.name: bundleId
optinalQueryParams.desc: If provided, only items with the given bundleId will be returned.

optinalQueryParams.name: includeDeleted
optinalQueryParams.desc: If true, tombstone records for deleted items will be returned.

optinalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optinalQueryParams.desc: The maximum number of items to include in the response, used for paging.

optinalQueryParams.name: orderBy
optinalQueryParams.desc: Controls the order in which timeline items are returned.

enum.name: displayTime
enum.desc: Results will be ordered by displayTime (default). This is the same ordering as is used in the timeline on the device.

enum.name: writeTime
enum.desc: Results will be ordered by the time at which they were last written to the data store.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc: Token for the page of results to return.

optinalQueryParams.name: pinnedOnly
optinalQueryParams.desc: If true, only pinned items will be returned.

methods.name: patch
methods.desc: Updates a timeline item in place. This method supports patch semantics.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the timeline item.

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Updates a timeline item in place.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the timeline item.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Returns a list of attachments for a timeline item.

pathParams.name: itemId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the timeline item whose attachments should be listed.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Deletes an attachment from a timeline item.

pathParams.name: itemId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the timeline item the attachment belongs to.

pathParams.name: attachmentId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the attachment.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Retrieves an attachment on a timeline item by item ID and attachment ID.

pathParams.name: itemId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the timeline item the attachment belongs to.

pathParams.name: attachmentId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the attachment.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Adds a new attachment to a timeline item.

pathParams.name: itemId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the timeline item the attachment belongs to.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Inserts a new account for a user

pathParams.name: userToken
pathParams.desc: The ID for the user.

pathParams.name: accountType
pathParams.desc: Account type to be passed to Android Account Manager.

pathParams.name: accountName
pathParams.desc: The name of the account to be passed to the Android Account Manager.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Deletes a contact.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the contact.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets a single contact by ID.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the contact.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Inserts a new contact.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Retrieves a list of contacts for the authenticated user.

methods.name: patch
methods.desc: Updates a contact in place. This method supports patch semantics.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the contact.

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Updates a contact in place.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the contact.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Retrieves a list of locations for the user.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets a single location by ID.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the location or latest for the last known location.
